title: Resolution Rate by Selected Case Types
summary: Displays average resolution rates for various case types, highlighting top (100%) and bottom (0–1%) performers.
interpretation: General Requests like CONVENTION FACILITIES and AGING ADULT SERVICES are resolved perfectly, while Abandoned Vehicle and Color Curb cases have extremely low resolution rates, suggesting operational inefficiencies or deprioritization.

title: Top 10 Most Frequent Cases with Avg Resolution Rate
summary: Lists the most frequently reported case types with their resolution counts and average resolution rates.
interpretation: High-frequency cases like Street and Sidewalk Cleaning have relatively high resolution rates (0.88), while common but low-performing cases like Abandoned Vehicle and MUNI Feedback show poor resolution outcomes.

title: Correlation Heatmap (|r| ≥ 0.2 Annotated Only)
summary: Displays Pearson correlations between numeric and demographic variables, annotated for correlations ≥ 0.2.
interpretation: Resolution rate positively correlates with income (0.74) and the proportion of white and Asian residents, suggesting potential demographic disparities in case resolutions.

title: Resolution Time by Photo Attachment
summary: Compares the average time to resolution for cases with and without photo attachments.
interpretation: Cases with photos are resolved faster (~804 hours) than those without (~1152 hours), suggesting that visual evidence may expedite processing.

title: Trend of Resolution Rate Over Months (with Dotted Gaps for Predictions)
summary: Shows average resolution rates over time, including dotted lines for predicted or imputed values during gaps.
interpretation: Resolution rates improved significantly from 2012 to 2013, then gradually declined post-2016, indicating possible changes in service efficiency or policy.
